title: Update branding: set uploaded logo as default and change brand name color to dark brown

requirements.text: Add the uploaded logo image as the appâ€™s default brand logo asset at `/assets/generated/bao-saras-logo.dim_512x512.png` (frontend static asset), ensuring the Header displays this logo by default when no custom logo is stored in localStorage.

quotes: ADD THIS LOGO AND CHANGE THE COLOUR OF BRAND NAME TO DARK BROWN

acceptanceCriteria: A static image file exists at `frontend/public/assets/generated/bao-saras-logo.dim_512x512.png`.
With `localStorage.logoUrl` unset/cleared, the header logo renders using `/assets/generated/bao-saras-logo.dim_512x512.png`.

requirements.text: Change the displayed brand name text color in the Header from the current foreground color to a dark brown color.

quotes: ADD THIS LOGO AND CHANGE THE COLOUR OF BRAND NAME TO DARK BROWN

acceptanceCriteria: In the non-editing state, the Header brand name text renders in a dark brown color (not the default `text-foreground`).
The color change applies consistently on desktop and mobile header layouts.

constraints: Do not modify any files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (read-only).
Do not change the existing logo upload + localStorage persistence behavior.
nonGoals: Redesigning other parts of the UI beyond the logo asset and the brand name text color.

required: Cleaned/extracted version of the uploaded logo with transparent background, centered and padded for square display (bao-saras-logo.dim_512x512.png)
